title: Duntroon: The Royal Military College of Australia
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Canberra (A.C.T.) - Description and travel
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Parliament House (Canberra, A.C.T.)

Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Australia. Army. Citizen Military Forces
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Australian National University
abstract: Located in the nation's capital, Canberra, is Duntroon College, charged with training Australia's military leaders of the future.
description: The Royal Military College, Duntroon is the Australian Army's officer training establishment. It was founded at Duntroon, in the Australian Capital Territory, in 1911. Staff Cadets at Duntroon are seen undergoing academic training in chemistry and physics, mechanical, electrical and radio engineering, as well as all aspects of military and physical training.  Also includes scenes of recreational, sporting and social activities.
